text: Orestes A. Crowell (October 5, 1872 - August 17, 1967) was an American businessman, farmer, and politician. Born in Almond, Portage County, Wisconsin, Crowell went to the Almond High School and to the University of Wisconsin. Crowell was involved with farming, mercantile business, real estate, and organized the Portage County Bank of Almond. Crowell served on the Portage County Board of Supervisors, served as postmaster of Almond from 1896 to 1901, and was the first president of the village of Almond, when it was incorporated as a village, in 1905. Crowell served in the Wisconsin State Assembly, as a Republican, in 1909 and 1911. Crowell died in a hospital in Stevens Point, Wisconsin.Wisconsin Blue Book 1911, "Biographical Sketch of O. A. Crowell", pg. 776"O. A. Crowell, Almond Bank Founder, Dies", Oshkosh Daily Northwestern, August 18, 1967, pg. 18 ==References== Category:1872 births Category:1967 deaths Category:People from Portage County, Wisconsin Category:University of Wisconsin-Madison alumni Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Farmers from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:County supervisors in Wisconsin Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:American postmasters
title: Orestes A. Crowell
